beginning.npc_text: Hey. I didn't think anyone else would be out here this late.

options.text: It's a quiet spot. You come here often?
options.inner_thought: Engagement: Starting with a neutral, non-threatening observation.

options.text: Are you okay? You look pretty down.
options.inner_thought: Assumption: Jumping to conclusions too quickly can cause a person to retreat.

options.text: I saw this photo of a family back there... is it yours?
options.inner_thought: Connection: Using an environmental clue to show deep attentiveness.

options.text: I saw that termination letter on the desk... I'm so sorry.
options.inner_thought: Empathy: Acknowledging a specific pain point found in the environment.

opening_up_clue.npc_text: Yeah... my kids. I don't know how I'm going to look them in the eye after what happened.

options.text: They love you, Sam. The situation doesn't define your value to them.
options.inner_thought: Validation: Refocusing on relationships and worth.

opening_up.npc_text: Used to. Now it's the only place where I don't feel like I'm failing everyone.

options.text: Failing everyone? That sounds like a heavy burden to carry.
options.inner_thought: Validation: Acknowledging the weight of his feelings without judging.

options.text: I noticed your university grade sheet... it looked tough. Is that what's weight on you?
options.inner_thought: Specificity: Showing you've noticed the specific stressor.

options.text: Don't say that. I'm sure people care about you.
options.inner_thought: Toxic Positivity: Dismissing pain with platitudes shuts down the conversation.

deep_pain.npc_text: I've lost the job, the house... I think everyone would just be better off if I wasn't around.

options.text: When you say 'better off', are you saying you're thinking about suicide?
options.inner_thought: The Question: QPR mandates asking directly and clearly. It shows you are listening.

options.text: You shouldn't think that. It'll get better eventually.
options.inner_thought: Avoidance: Skipping the hard question leaves the person in danger.

direct_question.npc_text: I... I have the bottle in my bag. I was just sitting here waiting for the courage to do it.

options.text: I'm so glad you told me. I want to help you stay safe. Will you go with me to get some help?
options.inner_thought: Persuade: Listening is the first step to persuasion. Offer hope.

persuade.npc_text: I don't know who to even call. I'm so lost.

options.inner_thought: Refer: Connecting the person to professional, immediate life-saving support.

toxic_positivity.npc_text: That's what they always say. But they don't see the mess I've made.

options.text: I'm sorry, I was minimizing. Tell me more about what's going on.
options.inner_thought: Repair: Admitting you misspoke can rebuild trust.

defensive.npc_text: Look, I'm just here to look at the trees. Just leave me alone.

options.text: I'll give you some space, but I'm here if you change your mind.

success_end.message: Connection Established. Sam agreed to call the hotline. By listening and asking the direct question, you provided the bridge he needed back to safety.

leave_failure.message: Session Terminated. You left Sam alone while he was in a vulnerable state. In QPR training, never leaving a person in crisis alone is a critical rule.
